newsitem.title: CHINA: China foreign exchange market volume up in April.
newsitem.headline: China foreign exchange market volume up in April.

text.p: Turnover on China's interbank foreign exchange market based in Shanghai hit US$5.023 billion in April, the Shanghai Securities News said on Thursday. This was 21 percent up on the $4.14 billion traded in April last year.
Average daily transactions in the month reached US$228 million, four percent up on the figure for March, the newspaper said.
The market trades the yuan against the U.S. dollar, the Japanese yen and the Hong Kong dollar only. The central bank intervenes on a regular basis to keep the yuan moving in a tight range.
